title: Patanjali inaugurates Asia's largest orange processing unit in Nagpur
desc: Patanjali has inaugurated Asia's largest orange processing plant in Nagpur, Maharashtra, with a capacity of 800 tonnes per day. The project, costing Rs 1500 crore, aims to benefit farmers and create numerous jobs, focusing on zero-waste operations and producing export-quality products.

title: Opposition to raise tariff issue in Parliament on Monday
desc: Opposition parties plan to address the government's response to the US push for reciprocal tariffs in Parliament, along with concerns about population-based delimitation and the new language policy. The Congress questions whether Indian interests have been compromised in tariff negotiations, demanding clarity from Prime Minister Modi.

title: Araku Coffee should become next Starbucks: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu
desc: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu aims for Araku Coffee to become a global brand like Starbucks, establishing 100 pilot outlets. Agreements to expand Araku Coffee, partner with international entities, and support rural women were signed, alongside financial and training initiatives to empower women, including distributing free sewing machines and electric vehicles.

title: Challenges in building localised AI data and responsible frameworks: AWS' Shalini Kapoor
desc: AWS' Shalini Kapoor emphasised the need for India-specific AI data sets to address unique challenges in sectors like health and agriculture. She also highlighted the importance of responsible AI frameworks, model explainability, and user interaction in AI development.

title: Elon Musk’s DOGE whiz kids took matters into their own hands, flew to California to release water during raging Los Angeles wildfires
desc: Elon Musk’s DOGE whiz kids took matters into their own hands, attempting to turn on California’s water pumps during the devastating Los Angeles wildfires. Despite federal officials denying their request, DOGE staffers Tyler Hassen and Bryton Shang flew to California to activate the system themselves. However, maintenance shutdowns and lack of authority stopped them. Trump later ordered a massive water release, claiming it would prevent wildfires, though experts disagreed. Farmers raised concerns about the impact on irrigation.

title: Take Parliament into confidence: Congress to PM on Trump's India cutting trade tariff claim
desc: The Congress demanded PM Modi to clarify Trump's claim that India has agreed to lower trade tariffs. Opposition leader Jairam Ramesh raised concerns about the potential impact on Indian farmers and manufacturers, calling for transparency in Parliament. Trump asserted that India imposes massive tariffs, hindering US trade.

title: 'What has Modi government agreed to?' Jairam Ramesh questions Centre on Trump's tariff statement
desc: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh has questioned India's decision to reduce tariffs following Donald Trump's statement. With Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal in Washington, Ramesh is concerned about possible compromises affecting Indian farmers and manufacturers. This situation demands transparency from the Modi government, as it is seen as compromising national interests.

title: US tariffs on Canadian dairy, lumber could come 'today': Donald Trump
desc: President Donald Trump announced potential tariffs on Canadian dairy and lumber products, accusing Canada of unfair trade practices. Despite delaying some tariffs aimed at Canada and Mexico, Trump emphasized that the tariffs could be enacted soon if Canada does not adjust its trade policies, impacting US farmers and industries.

title: US stopping all federal funding to South Africa, Donald Trump says
desc: U.S. President Donald Trump announced that the United States will cease all federal funding to South Africa. Additionally, Trump stated that South African farmers facing safety concerns will be offered expedited U.S. citizenship. The new policy will take effect immediately, impacting the $323.4 million in planned U.S. aid for 2024.

title: Increase share of states in Central taxes pool to 48%, MP CM tells 16th Finance Commission
desc: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav called for an increase in states' share of Central taxes from 44% to 48% to boost development. Emphasizing the progress in various sectors, he highlighted the state's financial goals, major projects, and efforts to attract investment and support farmers.

title: 'Bear with me', Trump says as both farmers, consumers brace for tariff effects
desc: New tariffs on Mexico, Canada, and China are expected to significantly impact US farmers and meat producers, potentially hurting their profits and leading to higher consumer prices for some products. President Trump may offer aid payments to offset these losses, as he did during his first administration. However, the long-term effects could strain the economy and affect trade relationships.

title: Maha Kumbh 2025: Prayagraj boatman earns Rs 30 crore in just 45 days during mega festival
desc: Refuting the Samajwadi Party's claims of boatmen being exploited during Mahakumbh Mela, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath shared a success story of a boatman's family who earned Rs 30 crore in 45 days during the congregation in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26.

title: 'Bear with me,' Trump says as both farmers and consumers brace for tariff effects
desc: The new tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China are expected to impact U.S. farmers and meat producers, potentially resulting in higher prices for consumers and economic repercussions. While President Trump has asked farmers for patience, the situation remains uncertain, with farmers worried about increased costs and decreased profitability, and potential long-term damage to trading relationships.

title: Big step towards better animal health: PM Modi on Cabinet's approval for revised livestock program
desc: Prime Minister Modi praised the Union Cabinet's approved revision of the Livestock Health & Disease Control Programme (LHDCP), highlighting its potential to enhance animal health and farmer prosperity. The program, with a Rs. 3,880 crore budget, focuses on disease control, vaccination, mobile vet units, and affordable medicines for the years 2024-25 and 2025-26.

title: Cabinet okays supply of generic veterinary medicines at affordable rates under Livestock Health program
desc: The Cabinet has approved modifications to the Livestock Health and Disease Control Programme, allocating Rs 75 crore for distributing affordable, high-quality generic veterinary medicines under the new Pashu Aushadhi component. These medicines will be distributed through PM Kisan Samridhi Kendras and cooperatives, aiming to support farmers. Traditional veterinary medicine knowledge will also be documented and revived.

title: Amid protests, CM Bhagwant Mann calls Punjab 'dharna' state
desc: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expressed concern over the state becoming a 'dharna state' after inconclusive talks with Samyukta Kisan Morcha leaders. The ongoing protests are resulting in significant economic losses for the state. Farmer leaders, who plan to protest in Chandigarh, claimed multiple detentions and criticized Mann's handling of their concerns as disrespectful.

title: Mizoram govt presents Rs15,198 crore budget, allocates 75% more in flagship scheme
desc: Mizoram Chief Minister Lalduhoma presented a Rs 15,198.76 crore budget for 2025-2026, with a significant increase in fund allocation for the 'Bana Kaih' scheme and a new health insurance scheme. No new taxes were introduced, and the state's GSDP for the next fiscal year is projected at Rs 36,088.82 crore.

title: 'Dhobi ka kutta': Shama Mohamed shares Kangana Ranaut's old tweet on Rohit Sharma, says #JustAsking
desc: Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed faced backlash for calling Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma "fat" and "unimpressive." After deleting her tweet, she highlighted an old critical tweet from BJP MP Kangana Ranaut about Sharma. The controversy has sparked political debate, with BJP and Congress accusing each other of double standards regarding comments made by their members.

title: Andhra govt spending over Rs 12,400 cr on free power to farmers: Energy Minister Ravi Kumar
desc: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister G Ravi Kumar announced that the government is investing over Rs 12,400 crore to provide free power to farmers under the NDA-led administration. The state plans to supply nine hours of free electricity and has approved nearly 70,000 new connections. Efforts to curb illegal marijuana cultivation have also seen significant progress.

title: Not just biogas, explore all possibilities in dairy sector to push circular economy: Amit Shah
desc: Cooperation Minister Amit Shah stressed the importance of scaling up NDDB’s cowdung biogas generation models to 250 district dairy cooperatives in the next two years. This initiative aims to boost the second White Revolution by promoting sustainability, circularity, and enhancing farmers' incomes through the dairy sector.

title: Jharkhand govt tables Rs 1.45 lakh crore budget for FY 2025-26 in state assembly
desc: Jharkhand's government has presented a Rs 1.45 lakh crore budget for the 2025-26 financial year. Finance Minister Radhakrishna Kishore introduced the budget, highlighting its aim to cater to the needs of the poor, farmers, tribals, and women. This marks the first budget since Hemant Soren's government regained power in the recent assembly elections.

title: Andhra Pradesh's Araku Coffee earns organic certification, secures buyers from Europe, Tata group
desc: GCC has achieved organic certification for Araku coffee, facilitating entry into European markets and collaboration with Tata Consumer Products for marketing and sales. The certification process, ongoing since 2019, now involves 2,600 tribal farmers, ensuring increased and fair pricing for their organic produce.

title: Andhra Govt unveils Rs 3.22 lakh crore budget with focus on farmers, students, fishermen
desc: The Andhra Pradesh government, led by N Chandrababu Naidu, presented a ₹3.22 lakh crore budget focusing on school education and key electoral promises. The budget includes ₹20,000 annual aid per farmer, ₹15,000 yearly for school children under the 'Talliki Vandanam' scheme, and free electricity to schools. It also allocates significant funds to health, rural development, and irrigation projects.

title: Govt says achieved goal of setting up of 10,000 farmer producer organisations
desc: The government announced the achievement of establishing 10,000 farmer producer organisations (FPOs) under a central scheme, aimed at boosting agricultural productivity and income. This milestone involves significant financial and handholding support, positively impacting millions of farmers, including a substantial proportion of women.

title: Farmers' protest: Supreme Court to hear matter after March 19
desc: The Supreme Court deferred the hearing on the farmers' protest to March 19, recognizing ongoing dialogue between the Centre and farmers. The court noted the high-powered committee's efforts and awaited further negotiations. The Punjab government's involvement and aid to hunger-striking farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal were also acknowledged.

title: Another round of unity talks among farmer bodies remains inconclusive
desc: The unity talks between farmer bodies SKM, SKM (Non-political), and KMM remain inconclusive after four rounds, as significant differences persist. Despite detailed discussions and a focus on common programmes, complete unity is unattainable. Efforts continue to reconcile demands, including the legal guarantee of MSP for crops.

title: Ridiculous to say farmers' stubble burning causing Delhi pollution: Piyush Goyal
desc: Union Minister Piyush Goyal called it "ridiculous" to blame Punjab farmers for Delhi's pollution. He emphasized that the main causes are construction activities and vehicle emissions. Speaking at an industry event, Goyal advocated for precast construction and electric mobility to address urban pollution. He encouraged a collective effort to adopt cleaner practices rather than shifting blame.

title: Not received PM Kisan 19th instalment? Get this money in your bank account after doing e-KYC
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the 19th instalment of the PM Kisan Yojana. The PM-Kisan scheme provides Rs 6,000 annually in three installments. Farmers can now complete e-KYC via OTP, biometric, or face authentication methods. The process ensures transparency and prevents misuse.

title: Operative Kisan Credit Card amount crosses Rs 10 lakh crore benefiting 7.72 crore farmers
desc: The finance ministry announced that the Kisan Credit Card (KCC) scheme has provided over Rs 10 lakh crore in affordable loans to 7.72 crore farmers as of December 31, 2024, up from Rs 4.26 lakh crore in 2014. The government also offers interest subventions and plans to increase the loan limit to further benefit farmers.
